intro: Anemone udensis, commonly known as the European anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features showy, white to pale pink flowers with a distinctive central tuft of stamens. The plant has palmately divided, lobed leaves that are hairy and rough to the touch. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Anemone udensis is often found in woodlands, meadows, and along stream banks, where it contributes to early spring floral displays.
